q: Meanwhile, some are suggesting that Eric Schmidt is walking away now because he senses that Google's fortunes have peaked. Along with the continued rise of Facebook and Twitter, InformationWeek notes: He is stepping aside just as Google spins the wheel on its riskiest bet yet: the launch of Chrome OS, the company's Web-based operating system. His attempts to answer concerns about Google becoming Big Brother-like have yielded several foot-in-mouth moments. l In October, attendees at a forum organized by Atlantic Monthly heard him testify: We don't need you to type at all. We know where you are. We know where you've been. We can more or less know what you're thinking about. l In a CNN interview later that month, Eric Schmidt joked that users offended by photos of their homes showing up in Google's Street View mapping feature could`` just move.''
